title: Franco-German Entente: A Strategic Projection
intent: A storyworld projection from France to Germany, depicting the strategic value of an alliance against England. Uses Machiavellian framing to emphasize mutual gains and downplay risks.

forecast.question: Will the named rival move aggressively next phase?

message_frame.claim: A storyworld projection from France to Germany, depicting the strategic value of an alliance against England. Uses Machiavellian framing to emphasize mutual gains and downplay risks.
message_frame.evidence: FRANCE'S PROJECTION: The board stands at Spring 1901. England has built two fleets - an aggressive posture toward the continent. Germany faces a choice: compete with France for scraps, or join forces against the island power.
message_frame.ask: Consider the strategic position: England controls the seas while we share a land border.
